emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport System (AUTS)
emerging_technologies.description: A network of self-operating, interconnected transportation units designed to revolutionize urban mobility with minimal human intervention.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduced congestion, lower emissions, increased accessibility, but potential job displacement in transport-related sectors.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Infrastructure readiness, regulatory acceptance, public trust in AI and autonomous systems, and urban planning support.

emerging_technologies.name: In-Situ Resource Utilization (ISRU) for Space
emerging_technologies.description: Technologies to utilize lunar and Martian resources for construction, life support, and fuel production.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enables sustainable space colonization, reduces reliance on Earth, but raises questions about extraterrestrial property rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Success of space missions, technological breakthroughs in robotics and material processing, international space law.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Link for Cognitive Augmentation
emerging_technologies.description: A device that interfaces directly with the brain to enhance cognitive functions or restore lost abilities.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for cognitive enhancement, but ethical concerns about privacy, consent, and creating a cognitive divide.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological safety, regulatory approval, public acceptance of brain-computer interfaces, and ethical considerations.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Sustainable Energy Management
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that optimize energy distribution, predict demand, and integrate renewable sources seamlessly.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduced energy waste, increased efficiency, but potential for centralized control of energy systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Energy infrastructure readiness, regulatory support, technological integration, and data security concerns.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Personal Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced AI assistants capable of complex task management, personalized learning, and emotional intelligence.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in personal devices, smart homes, and workplaces, enhancing productivity and user experience.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain for Secure Digital Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Integration of blockchain for secure, transparent, and decentralized digital transactions and data management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Mainstream in finance, supply chain, and identity management, with growing applications in other sectors.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in urban planning and technology to create resilient, eco-friendly cities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improvement in quality of life, environmental conservation, but potential social stratification due to technology access.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing urbanization, climate change mitigation efforts, and the push for smart cities.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies enhancing human capabilities, from cognitive to physical enhancements.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Raises ethical questions about the nature of human identity, privacy, and potential for inequality.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Advancements in neuroscience, healthcare, and the quest for human enhancement.

epoch_themes.description: Expanding humanity's reach into space, focusing on sustainable colonization and resource utilization.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: New frontiers for economic growth, but also potential geopolitical tensions over space resources.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in space exploration, international collaboration, and private sector involvement.
